meanings.definition: A person whose business is preparing dead bodies for burial or cremation and making arrangements for funerals.
meanings.sent1: The undertaker carefully prepared the body for the funeral service.
meanings.sent2: The undertaker arranged the flowers and casket for the burial.
meanings.sent3: The undertaker joked that he was the last one to let you down.
meanings.sent4: She saw herself as an undertaker of old habits, burying them for good.
meanings.sent5: The undertaker's somber presence made the funeral even more solemn.

meanings.definition: A person who takes on a task or responsibility.
meanings.sent1: As the undertaker of the project, he ensured everything was completed on time.
meanings.sent2: The team leader acted as the undertaker for the challenging assignment.
meanings.sent3: The undertaker of the group project made sure everyone did their part.
meanings.sent4: She embraced her role as the undertaker of difficult decisions in the team.
meanings.sent5: Being the undertaker of the responsibility, he carried it with dedication.
